content: आदित्य {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [अदितेरपत्यं ण्य] {@--1@} Solar, belonging to, or born in, the solar line; <ls>U. 6. 18.</ls> {@--2@} Devoted to, or originating from, Aditi. {@--3@} Belonging to, or sprung from, the Ādityas. --त्यः {@--1@} A son of Aditi; a god, divinity in general. (The number of Ādityas appears to have been originally seven, of whom Varuṇa is the head, and the name Āditya was restricted to them. In the time of the Brāhmaṇas, however, the number of Ādityas rose to 12, representing the sun in the 12 months of the year; धाता मित्रोऽर्यमा रुद्रो वरुणः सूर्य एव चाभगो विवस्वान् पूषा च सविता दशमः स्मृतः .. एकादशस्तथा त्वष्टा विष्णुर्द्वादश उच्यते .); आदित्यानामहं विष्णुः <ls>Bg. 10. 21</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 24.</ls> (These 12 suns are supposed to shine only at the destruction of the universe; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ve. 3. 6</ls>; दग्धुं विश्वं दहनकिरणैर्नोदिता द्वादशार्काः). {@--2@} The sun. {@--3@} A name of Viṣṇu in his fifth or dwarf-incarnation; स्वयंभूः शंभुरादित्यः <ls>V. Sah.</ls> {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of the {%Arka%} plant. --त्यौ (dual) <ab>N.</ab> of a constellation, the seventh lunar mansion.
